title.value: Healthsheet: Development of a Transparency Artifact for Health Datasets
title.justification: The title clearly reflects the main focus and contribution of the paper, which is the development of the Healthsheet for healthcare datasets.
title.quote: Healthsheet: Development of a Transparency Artifact for Health Datasets. J. ACM 37, 4, Article 111 (August 2022), 19 pages. https://doi.org/10.1145/3531146.3533239

extractions.description: The paper discusses the development of Healthsheet, a transparency artifact for documenting and understanding healthcare datasets to enhance accountability and integrity in ML applications for healthcare. The context of health-specific applications motivated the adaptation of existing datasets documentation practices. Through expert interviews and case studies on healthcare datasets, the paper explores obstacles and incentives in creating Healthsheets, and reviews challenges in dataset documentation, its implications, and potential solutions. It also delves into various characteristics essential for thorough healthcare data documentation.

type.justification: The work includes empirical evaluations such as interviews with experts and case studies analyzing publicly available datasets.
type.quote: Through a series of semi-structured interviews, we adapt the datasheets for healthcare data documentation.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving the processes and documentation standards for healthcare datasets, specifically through the introduction of the Healthsheet.
name.quote: To begin addressing gaps in current practices, frameworks, and standards for the ethical collection of health data for ML, we intro-duce a contextualized type of datasheet that attends to the needs of healthcare data: Healthsheet.

name.justification: The paper centers on the role of data documentation in Machine Learning for healthcare, indicating the intersection with ML.
name.quote: Machine learning (ML) approaches have demonstrated promising results in a wide range of healthcare applications.

name.justification: The research addresses specific applications of ML in the healthcare sector.
name.quote: Machine learning (ML) approaches have demonstrated promising results in a wide range of healthcare applications.

name.justification: MIMIC-III is one of the three healthcare datasets used as a case study for the Healthsheet development.
name.quote: We then validated our proposed Healthsheet using 3 publicly available datasets, MIMIC-III [30], MSOAC [35] and Floodlight [6].

referenced_paper_title.value: MIMIC-III, a freely accessible critical care database
referenced_paper_title.justification: MIMIC-III was explicitly mentioned as part of the datasets used in validating the proposed Healthsheet and is a well-cited dataset in healthcare research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We then validated our proposed Healthsheet using 3 publicly available datasets, MIMIC-III [30], MSOAC [35] and Floodlight [6].

name.justification: MSOAC was utilized as a case study to analyze the application of the Healthsheet.
name.quote: We then validated our proposed Healthsheet using 3 publicly available datasets, MIMIC-III [30], MSOAC [35] and Floodlight [6].

referenced_paper_title.value: The MSOAC approach to developing performance outcomes to measure and monitor multiple sclerosis disability
referenced_paper_title.justification: MSOAC is specifically cited as a dataset used for case studies in this research, focusing on documentation practices.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We then validated our proposed Healthsheet using 3 publicly available datasets, MIMIC-III [30], MSOAC [35] and Floodlight [6].

name.justification: Floodlight is cited as one of the datasets used to adapt and validate the Healthsheet framework, being particularly dynamic and app-based.
name.quote: We then validated our proposed Healthsheet using 3 publicly available datasets, MIMIC-III [30], MSOAC [35] and Floodlight [6].

referenced_paper_title.value: Digital health: Smartphone-based monitoring of multiple sclerosis using Floodlight
referenced_paper_title.justification: Floodlight was mentioned directly as one of the datasets put to the test in the creation and assessment of Healthsheet for healthcare data.
